other_tests.findings: Lumbar puncture was not performed because of marked cerebral edema.
The hemorrhagic cellulitis was rapidly progressing.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Despite prompt initiation of appropriate antibiotic therapy and surgical fasciotomy, the condition progressed with increasing inotropic support required.

other_tests.findings: The first CT scan revealed low-density areas involving the bilateral temporo-parietal lobes and extending ventrally to the left frontal area, indicating cerebritis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: One week later, a repeated CT scan revealed left fronto-temporal hemorrhage.
